location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Pocket No. 13: Enclosure to Part III of Volume I of the Persian Gulf Gazetteer: Genealogical Table of the (Wahhābi) Āl Sa’ūd (’Anizah) Family of Southern Najd (Sheets Nos. 4 and 5.)' [Sheet No. 4]

physicalDescription.extent: This item is stored in 'Pocket No. 13' (f. 13Av) with 'Sheet No. 5' (f. 18).

mods.abstract: This item is a genealogical table, 'Sheet No. 4. Table of the Muhammad Branch of the Āl Sa’ūd Ruling Family of Southern Najd'. It contains 111 named individuals (in Arabic and English) of the Āl Sa‘ūd family of the ‘Anizah tribe descended from Sa‘ūd bin Muḥammad through his son Muḥammad. Some of these individuals appear with birth and death dates, as well as biographical information. For the connection of this branch with the other branches of the family, as well as chronology of the Wahhabi Amirs of Southern Najd and notes on the arrangements and compilation of this table, see Sheet No. 1 (folio 14).
